title: Bug 4971 - Strange 'copy package'
description:
When performing the 'copy package' operation in the Eclipse IDE, an error occurs. This error is observed specifically in the 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' package of the 'jdt.ui' plugin. The issue can be reproduced by following these steps: 

1. Create a new project ('xxx2') 
2. Open the package viewer 
3. Select a package in project 'A' 
4. From the context menu, choose 'Copy' 

Expected Behavior: The 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' package should be selected as the destination package for the 'Copy' operation.
OB: The destination package selected for the 'Copy' operation is not 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
EB: The destination package selected for the 'Copy' operation is 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
SR: To resolve this issue, please update the 'Copy' operation in the package viewer to select the package 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' as the destination for the 'Copy' operation.
